scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Cease to persuade, my loving Proteus:

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Home-keeping youth have ever homely wits.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Were't not affection chains thy tender days

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: To the sweet glances of thy honour'd love,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: I rather would entreat thy company

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: To see the wonders of the world abroad,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Than, living dully sluggardized at home,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Wear out thy youth with shapeless idleness.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: But since thou lovest, love still and thrive therein,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Even as I would when I to love begin.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Wilt thou be gone? Sweet Valentine, adieu!

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Think on thy Proteus, when thou haply seest

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Some rare note-worthy object in thy travel:

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Wish me partaker in thy happiness

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: When thou dost meet good hap; and in thy danger,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: If ever danger do environ thee,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Commend thy grievance to my holy prayers,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: For I will be thy beadsman, Valentine.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And on a love-book pray for my success?

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Upon some book I love I'll pray for thee.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: That's on some shallow story of deep love:

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: How young Leander cross'd the Hellespont.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: That's a deep story of a deeper love:

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: For he was more than over shoes in love.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: 'Tis true; for you are over boots in love,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And yet you never swum the Hellespont.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Over the boots? nay, give me not the boots.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: No, I will not, for it boots thee not.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: What?

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: To be in love, where scorn is bought with groans;

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Coy looks with heart-sore sighs; one fading moment's mirth

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: With twenty watchful, weary, tedious nights:

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: If haply won, perhaps a hapless gain;

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: If lost, why then a grievous labour won;

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: However, but a folly bought with wit,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Or else a wit by folly vanquished.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: So, by your circumstance, you call me fool.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: So, by your circumstance, I fear you'll prove.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: 'Tis love you cavil at: I am not Love.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Love is your master, for he masters you:

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And he that is so yoked by a fool,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Methinks, should not be chronicled for wise.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Yet writers say, as in the sweetest bud

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: The eating canker dwells, so eating love

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Inhabits in the finest wits of all.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And writers say, as the most forward bud

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Is eaten by the canker ere it blow,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Even so by love the young and tender wit

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Is turn'd to folly, blasting in the bud,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Losing his verdure even in the prime

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And all the fair effects of future hopes.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: But wherefore waste I time to counsel thee,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: That art a votary to fond desire?

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Once more adieu! my father at the road

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Expects my coming, there to see me shipp'd.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And thither will I bring thee, Valentine.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Sweet Proteus, no; now let us take our leave.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: To Milan let me hear from thee by letters

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Of thy success in love, and what news else

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Betideth here in absence of thy friend;

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And likewise will visit thee with mine.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: All happiness bechance to thee in Milan!

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: As much to you at home! and so, farewell.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: He after honour hunts, I after love:

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: He leaves his friends to dignify them more,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I leave myself, my friends and all, for love.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Thou, Julia, thou hast metamorphosed me,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Made me neglect my studies, lose my time,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: War with good counsel, set the world at nought;

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Made wit with musing weak, heart sick with thought.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: Sir Proteus, save you! Saw you my master?

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But now he parted hence, to embark for Milan.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: Twenty to one then he is shipp'd already,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: And I have play'd the sheep in losing him.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Indeed, a sheep doth very often stray,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: An if the shepherd be a while away.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: You conclude that my master is a shepherd, then,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: and I a sheep?

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I do.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: Why then, my horns are his horns, whether I wake or sleep.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: A silly answer and fitting well a sheep.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: This proves me still a sheep.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: True; and thy master a shepherd.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: Nay, that I can deny by a circumstance.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: It shall go hard but I'll prove it by another.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: The shepherd seeks the sheep, and not the sheep the

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: shepherd; but I seek my master, and my master seeks

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: not me: therefore I am no sheep.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: The sheep for fodder follow the shepherd; the

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: shepherd for food follows not the sheep: thou for

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: wages followest thy master; thy master for wages

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: follows not thee: therefore thou art a sheep.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: Such another proof will make me cry 'baa.'

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But, dost thou hear? gavest thou my letter to Julia?

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: Ay sir: I, a lost mutton, gave your letter to her,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: a laced mutton, and she, a laced mutton, gave me, a

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: lost mutton, nothing for my labour.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Here's too small a pasture for such store of muttons.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: If the ground be overcharged, you were best stick her.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Nay: in that you are astray, 'twere best pound you.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: Nay, sir, less than a pound shall serve me for

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: carrying your letter.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: You mistake; I mean the pound,--a pinfold.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: From a pound to a pin? fold it over and over,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'Tis threefold too little for carrying a letter to

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: your lover.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But what said she?

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: First nodding  Ay.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Nod--Ay--why, that's noddy.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: You mistook, sir; I say, she did nod: and you ask

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: me if she did nod; and I say, 'Ay.'

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And that set together is noddy.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: Now you have taken the pains to set it together,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: take it for your pains.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: No, no; you shall have it for bearing the letter.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: Well, I perceive I must be fain to bear with you.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Why sir, how do you bear with me?

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: Marry, sir, the letter, very orderly; having nothing

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: but the word 'noddy' for my pains.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Beshrew me, but you have a quick wit.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: And yet it cannot overtake your slow purse.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Come come, open the matter in brief: what said she?

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: Open your purse, that the money and the matter may

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: be both at once delivered.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Well, sir, here is for your pains. What said she?

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: Truly, sir, I think you'll hardly win her.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Why, couldst thou perceive so much from her?

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: Sir, I could perceive nothing at all from her; no,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: not so much as a ducat for delivering your letter:

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: and being so hard to me that brought your mind, I

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: fear she'll prove as hard to you in telling your

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: mind. Give her no token but stones; for she's as

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: hard as steel.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: What said she? nothing?

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: No, not so much as 'Take this for thy pains.' To

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: testify your bounty, I thank you, you have testerned

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: me; in requital whereof, henceforth carry your

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: SPEED
line: letters yourself: and so, sir, I'll commend you to my master.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Go, go, be gone, to save your ship from wreck,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Which cannot perish having thee aboard,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Being destined to a drier death on shore.

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I must go send some better messenger:

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I fear my Julia would not deign my lines,

scene: SCENE I.  Verona. An open place.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Receiving them from such a worthless post.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: But say, Lucetta, now we are alone,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Wouldst thou then counsel me to fall in love?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Ay, madam, so you stumble not unheedfully.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Of all the fair resort of gentlemen

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: That every day with parle encounter me,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: In thy opinion which is worthiest love?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Please you repeat their names, I'll show my mind

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: According to my shallow simple skill.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: What think'st thou of the fair Sir Eglamour?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: As of a knight well-spoken, neat and fine;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: But, were I you, he never should be mine.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: What think'st thou of the rich Mercatio?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Well of his wealth; but of himself, so so.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: What think'st thou of the gentle Proteus?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Lord, Lord! to see what folly reigns in us!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: How now! what means this passion at his name?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Pardon, dear madam: 'tis a passing shame

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: That I, unworthy body as I am,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Should censure thus on lovely gentlemen.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Why not on Proteus, as of all the rest?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Then thus: of many good I think him best.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Your reason?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: I have no other, but a woman's reason;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: I think him so because I think him so.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: And wouldst thou have me cast my love on him?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Ay, if you thought your love not cast away.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Why he, of all the rest, hath never moved me.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Yet he, of all the rest, I think, best loves ye.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: His little speaking shows his love but small.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Fire that's closest kept burns most of all.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: They do not love that do not show their love.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: O, they love least that let men know their love.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: I would I knew his mind.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Peruse this paper, madam.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: 'To Julia.' Say, from whom?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: That the contents will show.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Say, say, who gave it thee?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Valentine's page; and sent, I think, from Proteus.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: He would have given it you; but I, being in the way,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Did in your name receive it: pardon the

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: fault I pray.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Now, by my modesty, a goodly broker!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Dare you presume to harbour wanton lines?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: To whisper and conspire against my youth?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Now, trust me, 'tis an office of great worth

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: And you an officer fit for the place.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Or else return no more into my sight.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: To plead for love deserves more fee than hate.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Will ye be gone?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: That you may ruminate.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: And yet I would I had o'erlooked the letter:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: It were a shame to call her back again

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: And pray her to a fault for which I chid her.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: What a fool is she, that knows I am a maid,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: And would not force the letter to my view!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Since maids, in modesty, say 'no' to that

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Which they would have the profferer construe 'ay.'

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Fie, fie, how wayward is this foolish love

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: That, like a testy babe, will scratch the nurse

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: And presently all humbled kiss the rod!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: How churlishly I chid Lucetta hence,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: When willingly I would have had her here!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: How angerly I taught my brow to frown,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: When inward joy enforced my heart to smile!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: My penance is to call Lucetta back

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: And ask remission for my folly past.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: What ho! Lucetta!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: What would your ladyship?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Is't near dinner-time?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: I would it were,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: That you might kill your stomach on your meat

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: And not upon your maid.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: What is't that you took up so gingerly?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Nothing.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Why didst thou stoop, then?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: To take a paper up that I let fall.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: And is that paper nothing?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Nothing concerning me.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Then let it lie for those that it concerns.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Madam, it will not lie where it concerns

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Unless it have a false interpeter.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Some love of yours hath writ to you in rhyme.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: That I might sing it, madam, to a tune.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Give me a note: your ladyship can set.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: As little by such toys as may be possible.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Best sing it to the tune of 'Light o' love.'

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: It is too heavy for so light a tune.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Heavy! belike it hath some burden then?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Ay, and melodious were it, would you sing it.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: And why not you?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: I cannot reach so high.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Let's see your song. How now, minion!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Keep tune there still, so you will sing it out:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: And yet methinks I do not like this tune.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: You do not?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: No, madam; it is too sharp.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: You, minion, are too saucy.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Nay, now you are too flat

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: And mar the concord with too harsh a descant:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: There wanteth but a mean to fill your song.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: The mean is drown'd with your unruly bass.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Indeed, I bid the base for Proteus.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: This babble shall not henceforth trouble me.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Here is a coil with protestation!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Go get you gone, and let the papers lie:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: You would be fingering them, to anger me.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: She makes it strange; but she would be best pleased

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: To be so anger'd with another letter.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Nay, would I were so anger'd with the same!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: O hateful hands, to tear such loving words!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Injurious wasps, to feed on such sweet honey

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: And kill the bees that yield it with your stings!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: I'll kiss each several paper for amends.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Look, here is writ 'kind Julia.' Unkind Julia!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: As in revenge of thy ingratitude,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: I throw thy name against the bruising stones,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Trampling contemptuously on thy disdain.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: And here is writ 'love-wounded Proteus.'

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Poor wounded name! my bosom as a bed

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Shall lodge thee till thy wound be thoroughly heal'd;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: And thus I search it with a sovereign kiss.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: But twice or thrice was 'Proteus' written down.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Be calm, good wind, blow not a word away

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Till I have found each letter in the letter,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Except mine own name: that some whirlwind bear

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Unto a ragged fearful-hanging rock

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: And throw it thence into the raging sea!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Lo, here in one line is his name twice writ,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: 'Poor forlorn Proteus, passionate Proteus,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: To the sweet Julia:' that I'll tear away.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: And yet I will not, sith so prettily

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: He couples it to his complaining names.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Thus will I fold them one on another:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Now kiss, embrace, contend, do what you will.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Madam,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Dinner is ready, and your father stays.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Well, let us go.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: What, shall these papers lie like tell-tales here?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: If you respect them, best to take them up.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Nay, I was taken up for laying them down:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Yet here they shall not lie, for catching cold.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: I see you have a month's mind to them.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Ay, madam, you may say what sights you see;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: I see things too, although you judge I wink.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Garden of JULIA's house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Come, come; will't please you go?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Tell me, Panthino, what sad talk was that

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Wherewith my brother held you in the cloister?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: 'Twas of his nephew Proteus, your son.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Why, what of him?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: He wonder'd that your lordship

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: Would suffer him to spend his youth at home,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: While other men, of slender reputation,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: Put forth their sons to seek preferment out:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: Some to the wars, to try their fortune there;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: Some to discover islands far away;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: Some to the studious universities.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: For any or for all these exercises,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: He said that Proteus your son was meet,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: And did request me to importune you

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: To let him spend his time no more at home,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: Which would be great impeachment to his age,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: In having known no travel in his youth.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Nor need'st thou much importune me to that

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Whereon this month I have been hammering.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: I have consider'd well his loss of time

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: And how he cannot be a perfect man,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Not being tried and tutor'd in the world:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Experience is by industry achieved

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: And perfected by the swift course of time.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Then tell me, whither were I best to send him?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: I think your lordship is not ignorant

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: How his companion, youthful Valentine,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: Attends the emperor in his royal court.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: I know it well.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: 'Twere good, I think, your lordship sent him thither:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: There shall he practise tilts and tournaments,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: Hear sweet discourse, converse with noblemen.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: And be in eye of every exercise

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: Worthy his youth and nobleness of birth.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: I like thy counsel; well hast thou advised:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: And that thou mayst perceive how well I like it,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: The execution of it shall make known.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Even with the speediest expedition

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: I will dispatch him to the emperor's court.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: To-morrow, may it please you, Don Alphonso,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: With other gentlemen of good esteem,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: Are journeying to salute the emperor

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: And to commend their service to his will.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Good company; with them shall Proteus go:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: And, in good time! now will we break with him.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Sweet love! sweet lines! sweet life!

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Here is her hand, the agent of her heart;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Here is her oath for love, her honour's pawn.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: O, that our fathers would applaud our loves,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: To seal our happiness with their consents!

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: O heavenly Julia!

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: How now! what letter are you reading there?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: May't please your lordship, 'tis a word or two

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Of commendations sent from Valentine,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Deliver'd by a friend that came from him.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Lend me the letter; let me see what news.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: There is no news, my lord, but that he writes

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: How happily he lives, how well beloved

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And daily graced by the emperor;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Wishing me with him, partner of his fortune.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: And how stand you affected to his wish?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: As one relying on your lordship's will

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And not depending on his friendly wish.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: My will is something sorted with his wish.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Muse not that I thus suddenly proceed;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: For what I will, I will, and there an end.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: I am resolved that thou shalt spend some time

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: With Valentinus in the emperor's court:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: What maintenance he from his friends receives,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Like exhibition thou shalt have from me.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: To-morrow be in readiness to go:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Excuse it not, for I am peremptory.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: My lord, I cannot be so soon provided:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Please you, deliberate a day or two.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Look, what thou want'st shall be sent after thee:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: No more of stay! to-morrow thou must go.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Come on, Panthino: you shall be employ'd

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: To hasten on his expedition.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Thus have I shunn'd the fire for fear of burning,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And drench'd me in the sea, where I am drown'd.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I fear'd to show my father Julia's letter,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Lest he should take exceptions to my love;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And with the vantage of mine own excuse

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Hath he excepted most against my love.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: O, how this spring of love resembleth

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: The uncertain glory of an April day,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Which now shows all the beauty of the sun,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And by and by a cloud takes all away!

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: Sir Proteus, your father calls for you:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: He is in haste; therefore, I pray you to go.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Why, this it is: my heart accords thereto,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. ANTONIO's house.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And yet a thousand times it answers 'no.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: Sir, your glove.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Not mine; my gloves are on.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: Why, then, this may be yours, for this is but one.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Ha! let me see: ay, give it me, it's mine:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Sweet ornament that decks a thing divine!

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Ah, Silvia, Silvia!

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: Madam Silvia! Madam Silvia!

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: How now, sirrah?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: She is not within hearing, sir.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Why, sir, who bade you call her?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: Your worship, sir; or else I mistook.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Well, you'll still be too forward.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: And yet I was last chidden for being too slow.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Go to, sir: tell me, do you know Madam Silvia?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: She that your worship loves?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Why, how know you that I am in love?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: Marry, by these special marks: first, you have

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: learned, like Sir Proteus, to wreathe your arms,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: like a malecontent; to relish a love-song, like a

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: robin-redbreast; to walk alone, like one that had

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: the pestilence; to sigh, like a school-boy that had

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: lost his A B C; to weep, like a young wench that had

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: buried her grandam; to fast, like one that takes

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: diet; to watch like one that fears robbing; to

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A street.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: losing the flood, lose thy voyage, and, in losing

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A street.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: thy voyage, lose thy master, and, in losing thy

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A street.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: master, lose thy service, and, in losing thy

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A street.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: service,--Why dost thou stop my mouth?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: For fear thou shouldst lose thy tongue.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A street.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: Where should I lose my tongue?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: In thy tale.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A street.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: In thy tail!

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Lose the tide, and the voyage, and the master, and

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: the service, and the tied! Why, man, if the river

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: were dry, I am able to fill it with my tears; if the

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: wind were down, I could drive the boat with my sighs.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A street.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: Come, come away, man; I was sent to call thee.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Sir, call me what thou darest.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A street.
speaker: PANTHINO
line: Wilt thou go?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Well, I will go.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Servant!

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Mistress?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: Master, Sir Thurio frowns on you.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Ay, boy, it's for love.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: Not of you.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Of my mistress, then.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'Twere good you knocked him.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Servant, you are sad.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Indeed, madam, I seem so.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: Seem you that you are not?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Haply I do.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: So do counterfeits.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: So do you.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: What seem I that I am not?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Wise.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: What instance of the contrary?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Your folly.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: And how quote you my folly?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: I quote it in your jerkin.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: My jerkin is a doublet.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Well, then, I'll double your folly.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: How?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SILVIA
line: What, angry, Sir Thurio! do you change colour?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Give him leave, madam; he is a kind of chameleon.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: That hath more mind to feed on your blood than live

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: in your air.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: You have said, sir.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: Ay, sir, and done too, for this time.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: I know it well, sir; you always end ere you begin.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SILVIA
line: A fine volley of words, gentlemen, and quickly shot off.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: 'Tis indeed, madam; we thank the giver.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Who is that, servant?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Yourself, sweet lady; for you gave the fire. Sir

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Thurio borrows his wit from your ladyship's looks,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: and spends what he borrows kindly in your company.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: Sir, if you spend word for word with me, I shall

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: make your wit bankrupt.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: I know it well, sir; you have an exchequer of words,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: and, I think, no other treasure to give your

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: followers, for it appears by their bare liveries,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: that they live by your bare words.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SILVIA
line: No more, gentlemen, no more:--here comes my father.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Now, daughter Silvia, you are hard beset.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Sir Valentine, your father's in good health:

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: What say you to a letter from your friends

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Of much good news?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: My lord, I will be thankful.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: To any happy messenger from thence.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Know ye Don Antonio, your countryman?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Ay, my good lord, I know the gentleman

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: To be of worth and worthy estimation

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And not without desert so well reputed.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Hath he not a son?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Ay, my good lord; a son that well deserves

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: The honour and regard of such a father.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: You know him well?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: I know him as myself; for from our infancy

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: We have conversed and spent our hours together:

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And though myself have been an idle truant,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Omitting the sweet benefit of time

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: To clothe mine age with angel-like perfection,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Yet hath Sir Proteus, for that's his name,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Made use and fair advantage of his days;

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: His years but young, but his experience old;

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: His head unmellow'd, but his judgment ripe;

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And, in a word, for far behind his worth

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Comes all the praises that I now bestow,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: He is complete in feature and in mind

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: With all good grace to grace a gentleman.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Beshrew me, sir, but if he make this good,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: He is as worthy for an empress' love

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: As meet to be an emperor's counsellor.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Well, sir, this gentleman is come to me,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: With commendation from great potentates;

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: And here he means to spend his time awhile:

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: I think 'tis no unwelcome news to you.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Should I have wish'd a thing, it had been he.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Welcome him then according to his worth.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Silvia, I speak to you, and you, Sir Thurio;

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: For Valentine, I need not cite him to it:

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: I will send him hither to you presently.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: This is the gentleman I told your ladyship

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Had come along with me, but that his mistress

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Did hold his eyes lock'd in her crystal looks.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Belike that now she hath enfranchised them

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Upon some other pawn for fealty.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Nay, sure, I think she holds them prisoners still.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Nay, then he should be blind; and, being blind

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SILVIA
line: How could he see his way to seek out you?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Why, lady, Love hath twenty pair of eyes.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: They say that Love hath not an eye at all.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: To see such lovers, Thurio, as yourself:

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Upon a homely object Love can wink.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Have done, have done; here comes the gentleman.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Welcome, dear Proteus! Mistress, I beseech you,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Confirm his welcome with some special favour.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SILVIA
line: His worth is warrant for his welcome hither,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SILVIA
line: If this be he you oft have wish'd to hear from.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Mistress, it is: sweet lady, entertain him

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: To be my fellow-servant to your ladyship.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Too low a mistress for so high a servant.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Not so, sweet lady: but too mean a servant

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: To have a look of such a worthy mistress.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Leave off discourse of disability:

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Sweet lady, entertain him for your servant.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: My duty will I boast of; nothing else.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SILVIA
line: And duty never yet did want his meed:

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Servant, you are welcome to a worthless mistress.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I'll die on him that says so but yourself.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SILVIA
line: That you are welcome?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: That you are worthless.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: Madam, my lord your father would speak with you.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SILVIA
line: I wait upon his pleasure. Come, Sir Thurio,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Go with me. Once more, new servant, welcome:

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SILVIA
line: I'll leave you to confer of home affairs;

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SILVIA
line: When you have done, we look to hear from you.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: We'll both attend upon your ladyship.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Now, tell me, how do all from whence you came?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Your friends are well and have them much commended.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And how do yours?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I left them all in health.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: How does your lady? and how thrives your love?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: My tales of love were wont to weary you;

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I know you joy not in a love discourse.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Ay, Proteus, but that life is alter'd now:

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: I have done penance for contemning Love,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Whose high imperious thoughts have punish'd me

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: With bitter fasts, with penitential groans,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: With nightly tears and daily heart-sore sighs;

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: For in revenge of my contempt of love,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Love hath chased sleep from my enthralled eyes

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And made them watchers of mine own heart's sorrow.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: O gentle Proteus, Love's a mighty lord,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And hath so humbled me, as, I confess,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: There is no woe to his correction,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Nor to his service no such joy on earth.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Now no discourse, except it be of love;

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Now can I break my fast, dine, sup and sleep,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Upon the very naked name of love.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Enough; I read your fortune in your eye.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Was this the idol that you worship so?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Even she; and is she not a heavenly saint?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: No; but she is an earthly paragon.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Call her divine.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I will not flatter her.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: O, flatter me; for love delights in praises.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: When I was sick, you gave me bitter pills,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And I must minister the like to you.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Then speak the truth by her; if not divine,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Yet let her be a principality,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Sovereign to all the creatures on the earth.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Except my mistress.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Sweet, except not any;

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Except thou wilt except against my love.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Have I not reason to prefer mine own?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And I will help thee to prefer her too:

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: She shall be dignified with this high honour--

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: To bear my lady's train, lest the base earth

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Should from her vesture chance to steal a kiss

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And, of so great a favour growing proud,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Disdain to root the summer-swelling flower

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And make rough winter everlastingly.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Why, Valentine, what braggardism is this?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Pardon me, Proteus: all I can is nothing

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: To her whose worth makes other worthies nothing;

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: She is alone.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Then let her alone.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Not for the world: why, man, she is mine own,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And I as rich in having such a jewel

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: As twenty seas, if all their sand were pearl,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: The water nectar and the rocks pure gold.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Forgive me that I do not dream on thee,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Because thou see'st me dote upon my love.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: My foolish rival, that her father likes

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Only for his possessions are so huge,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Is gone with her along, and I must after,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: For love, thou know'st, is full of jealousy.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But she loves you?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Ay, and we are betroth'd: nay, more, our,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: marriage-hour,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: With all the cunning manner of our flight,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Determined of; how I must climb her window,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: The ladder made of cords, and all the means

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Plotted and 'greed on for my happiness.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Good Proteus, go with me to my chamber,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: In these affairs to aid me with thy counsel.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Go on before; I shall inquire you forth:

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I must unto the road, to disembark

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Some necessaries that I needs must use,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And then I'll presently attend you.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Will you make haste?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I will.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Even as one heat another heat expels,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Or as one nail by strength drives out another,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: So the remembrance of my former love

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Is by a newer object quite forgotten.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Is it mine, or Valentine's praise,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Her true perfection, or my false transgression,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: That makes me reasonless to reason thus?

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: She is fair; and so is Julia that I love--

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: That I did love, for now my love is thaw'd;

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Which, like a waxen image, 'gainst a fire,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Bears no impression of the thing it was.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Methinks my zeal to Valentine is cold,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And that I love him not as I was wont.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: O, but I love his lady too too much,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And that's the reason I love him so little.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: How shall I dote on her with more advice,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: That thus without advice begin to love her!

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: 'Tis but her picture I have yet beheld,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And that hath dazzled my reason's light;

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But when I look on her perfections,

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: There is no reason but I shall be blind.

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: If I can cheque my erring love, I will;

scene: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: If not, to compass her I'll use my skill.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: SPEED
line: Launce! by mine honesty, welcome to Milan!

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Forswear not thyself, sweet youth, for I am not

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: welcome. I reckon this always, that a man is never

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: undone till he be hanged, nor never welcome to a

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: place till some certain shot be paid and the hostess

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: say 'Welcome!'

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: SPEED
line: Come on, you madcap, I'll to the alehouse with you

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: SPEED
line: presently; where, for one shot of five pence, thou

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: SPEED
line: shalt have five thousand welcomes. But, sirrah, how

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: SPEED
line: did thy master part with Madam Julia?

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Marry, after they closed in earnest, they parted very

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: fairly in jest.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: SPEED
line: But shall she marry him?

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: No.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: SPEED
line: How then? shall he marry her?

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: No, neither.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: SPEED
line: What, are they broken?

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: No, they are both as whole as a fish.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: SPEED
line: Why, then, how stands the matter with them?

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Marry, thus: when it stands well with him, it

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: stands well with her.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: SPEED
line: What an ass art thou! I understand thee not.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: What a block art thou, that thou canst not! My

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: staff understands me.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: SPEED
line: What thou sayest?

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Ay, and what I do too: look thee, I'll but lean,

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: and my staff understands me.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: SPEED
line: It stands under thee, indeed.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Why, stand-under and under-stand is all one.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: SPEED
line: But tell me true, will't be a match?

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Ask my dog: if he say ay, it will! if he say no,

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: it will; if he shake his tail and say nothing, it will.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: SPEED
line: The conclusion is then that it will.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Thou shalt never get such a secret from me but by a parable.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'Tis well that I get it so. But, Launce, how sayest

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: SPEED
line: thou, that my master is become a notable lover?

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: I never knew him otherwise.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: SPEED
line: Than how?

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: A notable lubber, as thou reportest him to be.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: SPEED
line: Why, thou whoreson ass, thou mistakest me.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Why, fool, I meant not thee; I meant thy master.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: SPEED
line: I tell thee, my master is become a hot lover.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Why, I tell thee, I care not though he burn himself

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: in love. If thou wilt, go with me to the alehouse;

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: if not, thou art an Hebrew, a Jew, and not worth the

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: name of a Christian.

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: SPEED
line: Why?

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Because thou hast not so much charity in thee as to

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: go to the ale with a Christian. Wilt thou go?

scene: SCENE V.  The same. A street.
speaker: SPEED
line: At thy service.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: To leave my Julia, shall I be forsworn;

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: To love fair Silvia, shall I be forsworn;

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: To wrong my friend, I shall be much forsworn;

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And even that power which gave me first my oath

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Provokes me to this threefold perjury;

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Love bade me swear and Love bids me forswear.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: O sweet-suggesting Love, if thou hast sinned,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Teach me, thy tempted subject, to excuse it!

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: At first I did adore a twinkling star,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But now I worship a celestial sun.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Unheedful vows may heedfully be broken,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And he wants wit that wants resolved will

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: To learn his wit to exchange the bad for better.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Fie, fie, unreverend tongue! to call her bad,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Whose sovereignty so oft thou hast preferr'd

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: With twenty thousand soul-confirming oaths.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I cannot leave to love, and yet I do;

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But there I leave to love where I should love.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Julia I lose and Valentine I lose:

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: If I keep them, I needs must lose myself;

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: If I lose them, thus find I by their loss

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: For Valentine myself, for Julia Silvia.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I to myself am dearer than a friend,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: For love is still most precious in itself;

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And Silvia--witness Heaven, that made her fair!--

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Shows Julia but a swarthy Ethiope.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I will forget that Julia is alive,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Remembering that my love to her is dead;

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And Valentine I'll hold an enemy,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Aiming at Silvia as a sweeter friend.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I cannot now prove constant to myself,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Without some treachery used to Valentine.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: This night he meaneth with a corded ladder

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: To climb celestial Silvia's chamber-window,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Myself in counsel, his competitor.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Now presently I'll give her father notice

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Of their disguising and pretended flight;

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Who, all enraged, will banish Valentine;

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: For Thurio, he intends, shall wed his daughter;

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But, Valentine being gone, I'll quickly cross

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: By some sly trick blunt Thurio's dull proceeding.

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Love, lend me wings to make my purpose swift,

scene: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: As thou hast lent me wit to plot this drift!

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Counsel, Lucetta; gentle girl, assist me;

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: And even in kind love I do conjure thee,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Who art the table wherein all my thoughts

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Are visibly character'd and engraved,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: To lesson me and tell me some good mean

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: How, with my honour, I may undertake

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: A journey to my loving Proteus.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Alas, the way is wearisome and long!

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: A true-devoted pilgrim is not weary

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: To measure kingdoms with his feeble steps;

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Much less shall she that hath Love's wings to fly,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
