line: And when the flight is made to one so dear,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Of such divine perfection, as Sir Proteus.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Better forbear till Proteus make return.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: O, know'st thou not his looks are my soul's food?

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Pity the dearth that I have pined in,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: By longing for that food so long a time.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Didst thou but know the inly touch of love,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Thou wouldst as soon go kindle fire with snow

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: As seek to quench the fire of love with words.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: I do not seek to quench your love's hot fire,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: But qualify the fire's extreme rage,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Lest it should burn above the bounds of reason.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: The more thou damm'st it up, the more it burns.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: The current that with gentle murmur glides,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Thou know'st, being stopp'd, impatiently doth rage;

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: But when his fair course is not hindered,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: He makes sweet music with the enamell'ed stones,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Giving a gentle kiss to every sedge

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: He overtaketh in his pilgrimage,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: And so by many winding nooks he strays

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: With willing sport to the wild ocean.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Then let me go and hinder not my course

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: I'll be as patient as a gentle stream

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: And make a pastime of each weary step,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Till the last step have brought me to my love;

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: And there I'll rest, as after much turmoil

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: A blessed soul doth in Elysium.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: But in what habit will you go along?

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Not like a woman; for I would prevent

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: The loose encounters of lascivious men:

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Gentle Lucetta, fit me with such weeds

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: As may beseem some well-reputed page.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Why, then, your ladyship must cut your hair.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: No, girl, I'll knit it up in silken strings

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: With twenty odd-conceited true-love knots.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: To be fantastic may become a youth

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Of greater time than I shall show to be.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: What fashion, madam shall I make your breeches?

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: That fits as well as 'Tell me, good my lord,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: What compass will you wear your farthingale?'

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Why even what fashion thou best likest, Lucetta.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: You must needs have them with a codpiece, madam.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Out, out, Lucetta! that would be ill-favour'd.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: A round hose, madam, now's not worth a pin,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Unless you have a codpiece to stick pins on.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Lucetta, as thou lovest me, let me have

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: What thou thinkest meet and is most mannerly.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: But tell me, wench, how will the world repute me

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: For undertaking so unstaid a journey?

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: I fear me, it will make me scandalized.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: If you think so, then stay at home and go not.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Nay, that I will not.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Then never dream on infamy, but go.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: If Proteus like your journey when you come,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: No matter who's displeased when you are gone:

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: I fear me, he will scarce be pleased withal.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: That is the least, Lucetta, of my fear:

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: A thousand oaths, an ocean of his tears

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: And instances of infinite of love

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Warrant me welcome to my Proteus.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: All these are servants to deceitful men.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Base men, that use them to so base effect!

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: But truer stars did govern Proteus' birth

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: His words are bonds, his oaths are oracles,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: His love sincere, his thoughts immaculate,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: His tears pure messengers sent from his heart,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: His heart as far from fraud as heaven from earth.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: LUCETTA
line: Pray heaven he prove so, when you come to him!

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Now, as thou lovest me, do him not that wrong

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: To bear a hard opinion of his truth:

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Only deserve my love by loving him;

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: And presently go with me to my chamber,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: To take a note of what I stand in need of,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: To furnish me upon my longing journey.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: All that is mine I leave at thy dispose,

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: My goods, my lands, my reputation;

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Only, in lieu thereof, dispatch me hence.

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: Come, answer not, but to it presently!

scene: SCENE VII.  Verona. JULIA'S house.
speaker: JULIA
line: I am impatient of my tarriance.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Sir Thurio, give us leave, I pray, awhile;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: We have some secrets to confer about.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Now, tell me, Proteus, what's your will with me?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: My gracious lord, that which I would discover

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: The law of friendship bids me to conceal;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But when I call to mind your gracious favours

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Done to me, undeserving as I am,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: My duty pricks me on to utter that

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Which else no worldly good should draw from me.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Know, worthy prince, Sir Valentine, my friend,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: This night intends to steal away your daughter:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Myself am one made privy to the plot.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I know you have determined to bestow her

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: On Thurio, whom your gentle daughter hates;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And should she thus be stol'n away from you,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: It would be much vexation to your age.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Thus, for my duty's sake, I rather chose

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: To cross my friend in his intended drift

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Than, by concealing it, heap on your head

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: A pack of sorrows which would press you down,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Being unprevented, to your timeless grave.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Proteus, I thank thee for thine honest care;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Which to requite, command me while I live.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: This love of theirs myself have often seen,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Haply when they have judged me fast asleep,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: And oftentimes have purposed to forbid

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Sir Valentine her company and my court:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: But fearing lest my jealous aim might err

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: And so unworthily disgrace the man,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: A rashness that I ever yet have shunn'd,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: I gave him gentle looks, thereby to find

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: That which thyself hast now disclosed to me.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: And, that thou mayst perceive my fear of this,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Knowing that tender youth is soon suggested,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: I nightly lodge her in an upper tower,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: The key whereof myself have ever kept;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: And thence she cannot be convey'd away.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Know, noble lord, they have devised a mean

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: How he her chamber-window will ascend

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And with a corded ladder fetch her down;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: For which the youthful lover now is gone

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And this way comes he with it presently;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Where, if it please you, you may intercept him.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But, good my Lord, do it so cunningly

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: That my discovery be not aimed at;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: For love of you, not hate unto my friend,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Hath made me publisher of this pretence.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Upon mine honour, he shall never know

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: That I had any light from thee of this.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Adieu, my Lord; Sir Valentine is coming.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Sir Valentine, whither away so fast?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Please it your grace, there is a messenger

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: That stays to bear my letters to my friends,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And I am going to deliver them.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Be they of much import?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: The tenor of them doth but signify

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: My health and happy being at your court.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Nay then, no matter; stay with me awhile;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: I am to break with thee of some affairs

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: That touch me near, wherein thou must be secret.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: 'Tis not unknown to thee that I have sought

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: To match my friend Sir Thurio to my daughter.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: I know it well, my Lord; and, sure, the match

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Were rich and honourable; besides, the gentleman

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Is full of virtue, bounty, worth and qualities

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Beseeming such a wife as your fair daughter:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Cannot your Grace win her to fancy him?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: No, trust me; she is peevish, sullen, froward,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Proud, disobedient, stubborn, lacking duty,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Neither regarding that she is my child

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Nor fearing me as if I were her father;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: And, may I say to thee, this pride of hers,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Upon advice, hath drawn my love from her;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: And, where I thought the remnant of mine age

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Should have been cherish'd by her child-like duty,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: I now am full resolved to take a wife

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: And turn her out to who will take her in:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Then let her beauty be her wedding-dower;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: For me and my possessions she esteems not.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: What would your Grace have me to do in this?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: There is a lady in Verona here

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Whom I affect; but she is nice and coy

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: And nought esteems my aged eloquence:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Now therefore would I have thee to my tutor--

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: For long agone I have forgot to court;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Besides, the fashion of the time is changed--

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: How and which way I may bestow myself

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: To be regarded in her sun-bright eye.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Win her with gifts, if she respect not words:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Dumb jewels often in their silent kind

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: More than quick words do move a woman's mind.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: But she did scorn a present that I sent her.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: A woman sometimes scorns what best contents her.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Send her another; never give her o'er;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: For scorn at first makes after-love the more.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: If she do frown, 'tis not in hate of you,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: But rather to beget more love in you:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: If she do chide, 'tis not to have you gone;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: For why, the fools are mad, if left alone.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Take no repulse, whatever she doth say;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: For 'get you gone,' she doth not mean 'away!'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Flatter and praise, commend, extol their graces;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Though ne'er so black, say they have angels' faces.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: That man that hath a tongue, I say, is no man,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: If with his tongue he cannot win a woman.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: But she I mean is promised by her friends

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Unto a youthful gentleman of worth,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: And kept severely from resort of men,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: That no man hath access by day to her.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Why, then, I would resort to her by night.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Ay, but the doors be lock'd and keys kept safe,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: That no man hath recourse to her by night.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: What lets but one may enter at her window?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Her chamber is aloft, far from the ground,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: And built so shelving that one cannot climb it

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Without apparent hazard of his life.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Why then, a ladder quaintly made of cords,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: To cast up, with a pair of anchoring hooks,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Would serve to scale another Hero's tower,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: So bold Leander would adventure it.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Now, as thou art a gentleman of blood,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Advise me where I may have such a ladder.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: When would you use it? pray, sir, tell me that.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: This very night; for Love is like a child,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: That longs for every thing that he can come by.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: By seven o'clock I'll get you such a ladder.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: But, hark thee; I will go to her alone:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: How shall I best convey the ladder thither?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: It will be light, my lord, that you may bear it

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Under a cloak that is of any length.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: A cloak as long as thine will serve the turn?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Ay, my good lord.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Then let me see thy cloak:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: I'll get me one of such another length.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Why, any cloak will serve the turn, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: How shall I fashion me to wear a cloak?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: I pray thee, let me feel thy cloak upon me.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: What letter is this same? What's here? 'To Silvia'!

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: And here an engine fit for my proceeding.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: I'll be so bold to break the seal for once.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: 'My thoughts do harbour with my Silvia nightly,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: And slaves they are to me that send them flying:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: O, could their master come and go as lightly,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Himself would lodge where senseless they are lying!

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: My herald thoughts in thy pure bosom rest them:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: While I, their king, that hither them importune,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Do curse the grace that with such grace hath bless'd them,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Because myself do want my servants' fortune:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: I curse myself, for they are sent by me,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: That they should harbour where their lord would be.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: What's here?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: 'Silvia, this night I will enfranchise thee.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: 'Tis so; and here's the ladder for the purpose.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Why, Phaeton,--for thou art Merops' son,--

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Wilt thou aspire to guide the heavenly car

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: And with thy daring folly burn the world?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Wilt thou reach stars, because they shine on thee?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Go, base intruder! overweening slave!

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Bestow thy fawning smiles on equal mates,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: And think my patience, more than thy desert,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Is privilege for thy departure hence:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Thank me for this more than for all the favours

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Which all too much I have bestow'd on thee.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: But if thou linger in my territories

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Longer than swiftest expedition

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Will give thee time to leave our royal court,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: By heaven! my wrath shall far exceed the love

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: I ever bore my daughter or thyself.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Be gone! I will not hear thy vain excuse;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: But, as thou lovest thy life, make speed from hence.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And why not death rather than living torment?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: To die is to be banish'd from myself;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And Silvia is myself: banish'd from her

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Is self from self: a deadly banishment!

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: What light is light, if Silvia be not seen?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: What joy is joy, if Silvia be not by?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Unless it be to think that she is by

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And feed upon the shadow of perfection

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Except I be by Silvia in the night,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: There is no music in the nightingale;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Unless I look on Silvia in the day,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: There is no day for me to look upon;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: She is my essence, and I leave to be,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: If I be not by her fair influence

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Foster'd, illumined, cherish'd, kept alive.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: I fly not death, to fly his deadly doom:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Tarry I here, I but attend on death:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: But, fly I hence, I fly away from life.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Run, boy, run, run, and seek him out.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Soho, soho!

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: What seest thou?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Him we go to find: there's not a hair on's head

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: but 'tis a Valentine.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Valentine?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: No.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Who then? his spirit?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Neither.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: What then?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Nothing.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Can nothing speak? Master, shall I strike?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Who wouldst thou strike?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Nothing.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Villain, forbear.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Why, sir, I'll strike nothing: I pray you,--

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Sirrah, I say, forbear. Friend Valentine, a word.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: My ears are stopt and cannot hear good news,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: So much of bad already hath possess'd them.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Then in dumb silence will I bury mine,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: For they are harsh, untuneable and bad.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Is Silvia dead?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: No, Valentine.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: No Valentine, indeed, for sacred Silvia.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Hath she forsworn me?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: No, Valentine.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: No Valentine, if Silvia have forsworn me.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: What is your news?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Sir, there is a proclamation that you are vanished.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: That thou art banished--O, that's the news!--

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: From hence, from Silvia and from me thy friend.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: O, I have fed upon this woe already,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And now excess of it will make me surfeit.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Doth Silvia know that I am banished?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Ay, ay; and she hath offer'd to the doom--

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Which, unreversed, stands in effectual force--

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: A sea of melting pearl, which some call tears:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Those at her father's churlish feet she tender'd;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: With them, upon her knees, her humble self;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Wringing her hands, whose whiteness so became them

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: As if but now they waxed pale for woe:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But neither bended knees, pure hands held up,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Sad sighs, deep groans, nor silver-shedding tears,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Could penetrate her uncompassionate sire;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But Valentine, if he be ta'en, must die.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Besides, her intercession chafed him so,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: When she for thy repeal was suppliant,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: That to close prison he commanded her,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: With many bitter threats of biding there.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: No more; unless the next word that thou speak'st

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Have some malignant power upon my life:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: If so, I pray thee, breathe it in mine ear,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: As ending anthem of my endless dolour.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Cease to lament for that thou canst not help,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And study help for that which thou lament'st.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Time is the nurse and breeder of all good.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Here if thou stay, thou canst not see thy love;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Besides, thy staying will abridge thy life.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Hope is a lover's staff; walk hence with that

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And manage it against despairing thoughts.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Thy letters may be here, though thou art hence;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Which, being writ to me, shall be deliver'd

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Even in the milk-white bosom of thy love.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: The time now serves not to expostulate:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Come, I'll convey thee through the city-gate;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And, ere I part with thee, confer at large

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Of all that may concern thy love-affairs.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: As thou lovest Silvia, though not for thyself,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Regard thy danger, and along with me!

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: I pray thee, Launce, an if thou seest my boy,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Bid him make haste and meet me at the North-gate.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Go, sirrah, find him out. Come, Valentine.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: O my dear Silvia! Hapless Valentine!

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: I am but a fool, look you; and yet I have the wit to

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: think my master is a kind of a knave: but that's

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: all one, if he be but one knave. He lives not now

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: that knows me to be in love; yet I am in love; but a

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: team of horse shall not pluck that from me; nor who

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: 'tis I love; and yet 'tis a woman; but what woman, I

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: will not tell myself; and yet 'tis a milkmaid; yet

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: 'tis not a maid, for she hath had gossips; yet 'tis

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: a maid, for she is her master's maid, and serves for

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: wages. She hath more qualities than a water-spaniel;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: which is much in a bare Christian.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Here is the cate-log of her condition.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: 'Imprimis: She can fetch and carry.' Why, a horse

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: can do no more: nay, a horse cannot fetch, but only

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: carry; therefore is she better than a jade. 'Item:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: She can milk;' look you, a sweet virtue in a maid

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: with clean hands.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: How now, Signior Launce! what news with your

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: mastership?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: With my master's ship? why, it is at sea.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: Well, your old vice still; mistake the word. What

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: news, then, in your paper?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: The blackest news that ever thou heardest.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: Why, man, how black?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Why, as black as ink.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: Let me read them.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Fie on thee, jolt-head! thou canst not read.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: Thou liest; I can.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: I will try thee. Tell me this: who begot thee?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: Marry, the son of my grandfather.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: O illiterate loiterer! it was the son of thy

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: grandmother: this proves that thou canst not read.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: Come, fool, come; try me in thy paper.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: There; and St. Nicholas be thy speed!

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: Reads  'Imprimis: She can milk.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Ay, that she can.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'Item: She brews good ale.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: And thereof comes the proverb: 'Blessing of your

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: heart, you brew good ale.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'Item: She can sew.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: That's as much as to say, Can she so?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'Item: She can knit.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: What need a man care for a stock with a wench, when

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: she can knit him a stock?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'Item: She can wash and scour.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: A special virtue: for then she need not be washed

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: and scoured.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'Item: She can spin.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Then may I set the world on wheels, when she can

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: spin for her living.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'Item: She hath many nameless virtues.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: That's as much as to say, bastard virtues; that,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: indeed, know not their fathers and therefore have no names.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'Here follow her vices.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Close at the heels of her virtues.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'Item: She is not to be kissed fasting in respect

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: of her breath.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Well, that fault may be mended with a breakfast. Read on.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'Item: She hath a sweet mouth.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: That makes amends for her sour breath.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'Item: She doth talk in her sleep.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: It's no matter for that, so she sleep not in her talk.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'Item: She is slow in words.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: O villain, that set this down among her vices! To

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: be slow in words is a woman's only virtue: I pray

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: thee, out with't, and place it for her chief virtue.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'Item: She is proud.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Out with that too; it was Eve's legacy, and cannot

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: be ta'en from her.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'Item: She hath no teeth.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: I care not for that neither, because I love crusts.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'Item: She is curst.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Well, the best is, she hath no teeth to bite.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'Item: She will often praise her liquor.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: If her liquor be good, she shall: if she will not, I

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: will; for good things should be praised.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'Item: She is too liberal.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Of her tongue she cannot, for that's writ down she

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: is slow of; of her purse she shall not, for that

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: I'll keep shut: now, of another thing she may, and

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: that cannot I help. Well, proceed.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'Item: She hath more hair than wit, and more faults

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: than hairs, and more wealth than faults.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Stop there; I'll have her: she was mine, and not

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: mine, twice or thrice in that last article.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Rehearse that once more.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'Item: She hath more hair than wit,'--

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: More hair than wit? It may be; I'll prove it. The

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: cover of the salt hides the salt, and therefore it

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: is more than the salt; the hair that covers the wit

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: is more than the wit, for the greater hides the

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: less. What's next?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'And more faults than hairs,'--

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: That's monstrous: O, that that were out!

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: 'And more wealth than faults.'

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Why, that word makes the faults gracious. Well,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: I'll have her; and if it be a match, as nothing is

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: impossible,--

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: What then?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Why, then will I tell thee--that thy master stays

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: for thee at the North-gate.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: For me?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: For thee! ay, who art thou? he hath stayed for a

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: better man than thee.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: And must I go to him?

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Thou must run to him, for thou hast stayed so long

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: that going will scarce serve the turn.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: SPEED
line: Why didst not tell me sooner? pox of your love letters!

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: Now will he be swinged for reading my letter; an

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: unmannerly slave, that will thrust himself into

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: LAUNCE
line: secrets! I'll after, to rejoice in the boy's correction.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Sir Thurio, fear not but that she will love you,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Now Valentine is banish'd from her sight.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: Since his exile she hath despised me most,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: Forsworn my company and rail'd at me,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: That I am desperate of obtaining her.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: This weak impress of love is as a figure

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Trenched in ice, which with an hour's heat

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Dissolves to water and doth lose his form.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: A little time will melt her frozen thoughts

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: And worthless Valentine shall be forgot.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: How now, Sir Proteus! Is your countryman

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: According to our proclamation gone?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Gone, my good lord.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: My daughter takes his going grievously.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: A little time, my lord, will kill that grief.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: So I believe; but Thurio thinks not so.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Proteus, the good conceit I hold of thee--

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: For thou hast shown some sign of good desert--

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Makes me the better to confer with thee.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Longer than I prove loyal to your grace

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Let me not live to look upon your grace.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Thou know'st how willingly I would effect

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: The match between Sir Thurio and my daughter.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I do, my lord.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: And also, I think, thou art not ignorant

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: How she opposes her against my will

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: She did, my lord, when Valentine was here.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Ay, and perversely she persevers so.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: What might we do to make the girl forget

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: The love of Valentine and love Sir Thurio?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: The best way is to slander Valentine

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: With falsehood, cowardice and poor descent,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Three things that women highly hold in hate.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Ay, but she'll think that it is spoke in hate.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Ay, if his enemy deliver it:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Therefore it must with circumstance be spoken

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: By one whom she esteemeth as his friend.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Then you must undertake to slander him.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And that, my lord, I shall be loath to do:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: 'Tis an ill office for a gentleman,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Especially against his very friend.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Where your good word cannot advantage him,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Your slander never can endamage him;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Therefore the office is indifferent,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Being entreated to it by your friend.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: You have prevail'd, my lord; if I can do it

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: By ought that I can speak in his dispraise,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: She shall not long continue love to him.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But say this weed her love from Valentine,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: It follows not that she will love Sir Thurio.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: Therefore, as you unwind her love from him,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: Lest it should ravel and be good to none,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: You must provide to bottom it on me;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: Which must be done by praising me as much

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: As you in worth dispraise Sir Valentine.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: And, Proteus, we dare trust you in this kind,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Because we know, on Valentine's report,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: You are already Love's firm votary

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: And cannot soon revolt and change your mind.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Upon this warrant shall you have access

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Where you with Silvia may confer at large;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: For she is lumpish, heavy, melancholy,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: And, for your friend's sake, will be glad of you;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Where you may temper her by your persuasion

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: To hate young Valentine and love my friend.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: As much as I can do, I will effect:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But you, Sir Thurio, are not sharp enough;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: You must lay lime to tangle her desires

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: By wailful sonnets, whose composed rhymes

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Should be full-fraught with serviceable vows.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Ay,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Much is the force of heaven-bred poesy.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Say that upon the altar of her beauty

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: You sacrifice your tears, your sighs, your heart:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Write till your ink be dry, and with your tears

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Moist it again, and frame some feeling line

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: That may discover such integrity:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: For Orpheus' lute was strung with poets' sinews,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Whose golden touch could soften steel and stones,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Make tigers tame and huge leviathans

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Forsake unsounded deeps to dance on sands.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: After your dire-lamenting elegies,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Visit by night your lady's chamber-window

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: With some sweet concert; to their instruments

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Tune a deploring dump: the night's dead silence

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Will well become such sweet-complaining grievance.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: This, or else nothing, will inherit her.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: This discipline shows thou hast been in love.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: And thy advice this night I'll put in practise.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: Therefore, sweet Proteus, my direction-giver,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: Let us into the city presently

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: To sort some gentlemen well skill'd in music.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: I have a sonnet that will serve the turn

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: To give the onset to thy good advice.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: About it, gentlemen!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: We'll wait upon your grace till after supper,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And afterward determine our proceedings.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Even now about it! I will pardon you.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: First Outlaw
line: Fellows, stand fast; I see a passenger.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Second Outlaw
line: If there be ten, shrink not, but down with 'em.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: Stand, sir, and throw us that you have about ye:

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: If not: we'll make you sit and rifle you.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: SPEED
line: Sir, we are undone; these are the villains

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: SPEED
line: That all the travellers do fear so much.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: My friends,--

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: First Outlaw
line: That's not so, sir: we are your enemies.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Second Outlaw
line: Peace! we'll hear him.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: Ay, by my beard, will we, for he's a proper man.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Then know that I have little wealth to lose:

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: A man I am cross'd with adversity;

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: My riches are these poor habiliments,

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Of which if you should here disfurnish me,

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: You take the sum and substance that I have.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Second Outlaw
line: Whither travel you?

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: To Verona.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: First Outlaw
line: Whence came you?

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: From Milan.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: Have you long sojourned there?

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Some sixteen months, and longer might have stay'd,

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: If crooked fortune had not thwarted me.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: First Outlaw
line: What, were you banish'd thence?

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: I was.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Second Outlaw
line: For what offence?

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: For that which now torments me to rehearse:

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: I kill'd a man, whose death I much repent;

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: But yet I slew him manfully in fight,

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Without false vantage or base treachery.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: First Outlaw
line: Why, ne'er repent it, if it were done so.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: First Outlaw
line: But were you banish'd for so small a fault?

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: I was, and held me glad of such a doom.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Second Outlaw
line: Have you the tongues?

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: My youthful travel therein made me happy,

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Or else I often had been miserable.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: By the bare scalp of Robin Hood's fat friar,

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: This fellow were a king for our wild faction!

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: First Outlaw
line: We'll have him. Sirs, a word.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: SPEED
line: Master, be one of them; it's an honourable kind of thievery.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Peace, villain!

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Second Outlaw
line: Tell us this: have you any thing to take to?

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Nothing but my fortune.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: Know, then, that some of us are gentlemen,

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: Such as the fury of ungovern'd youth

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: Thrust from the company of awful men:

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: Myself was from Verona banished

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: For practising to steal away a lady,

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: An heir, and near allied unto the duke.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Second Outlaw
line: And I from Mantua, for a gentleman,

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Second Outlaw
line: Who, in my mood, I stabb'd unto the heart.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: First Outlaw
line: And I for such like petty crimes as these,

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: First Outlaw
line: But to the purpose--for we cite our faults,

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: First Outlaw
line: That they may hold excus'd our lawless lives;

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: First Outlaw
line: And partly, seeing you are beautified

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: First Outlaw
line: With goodly shape and by your own report

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: First Outlaw
line: A linguist and a man of such perfection

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: First Outlaw
line: As we do in our quality much want--

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Second Outlaw
line: Indeed, because you are a banish'd man,

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Second Outlaw
line: Therefore, above the rest, we parley to you:

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Second Outlaw
line: Are you content to be our general?

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Second Outlaw
line: To make a virtue of necessity

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Second Outlaw
line: And live, as we do, in this wilderness?

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: What say'st thou? wilt thou be of our consort?

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: Say ay, and be the captain of us all:

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: We'll do thee homage and be ruled by thee,

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: Love thee as our commander and our king.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: First Outlaw
line: But if thou scorn our courtesy, thou diest.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Second Outlaw
line: Thou shalt not live to brag what we have offer'd.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: I take your offer and will live with you,

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Provided that you do no outrages

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: On silly women or poor passengers.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: No, we detest such vile base practises.

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: Come, go with us, we'll bring thee to our crews,

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: And show thee all the treasure we have got,

scene: SCENE I.  The frontiers of Mantua. A forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: Which, with ourselves, all rest at thy dispose.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Already have I been false to Valentine

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And now I must be as unjust to Thurio.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Under the colour of commending him,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I have access my own love to prefer:

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But Silvia is too fair, too true, too holy,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: To be corrupted with my worthless gifts.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: When I protest true loyalty to her,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: She twits me with my falsehood to my friend;

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: When to her beauty I commend my vows,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: She bids me think how I have been forsworn

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: In breaking faith with Julia whom I loved:

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And notwithstanding all her sudden quips,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: The least whereof would quell a lover's hope,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Yet, spaniel-like, the more she spurns my love,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: The more it grows and fawneth on her still.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But here comes Thurio: now must we to her window,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And give some evening music to her ear.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: THURIO
line: How now, Sir Proteus, are you crept before us?

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Ay, gentle Thurio: for you know that love

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Will creep in service where it cannot go.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: THURIO
line: Ay, but I hope, sir, that you love not here.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Sir, but I do; or else I would be hence.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: THURIO
line: Who? Silvia?

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Ay, Silvia; for your sake.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: THURIO
line: I thank you for your own. Now, gentlemen,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: THURIO
line: Let's tune, and to it lustily awhile.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: Now, my young guest, methinks you're allycholly: I

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: pray you, why is it?

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: Marry, mine host, because I cannot be merry.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: Come, we'll have you merry: I'll bring you where

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: you shall hear music and see the gentleman that you asked for.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: But shall I hear him speak?

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: Ay, that you shall.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: That will be music.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: Hark, hark!

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: Is he among these?

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: Ay: but, peace! let's hear 'em.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: Who is Silvia? what is she,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: That all our swains commend her?

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: Holy, fair and wise is she;

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: The heaven such grace did lend her,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: That she might admired be.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: Is she kind as she is fair?

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: For beauty lives with kindness.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: Love doth to her eyes repair,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: To help him of his blindness,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: And, being help'd, inhabits there.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: Then to Silvia let us sing,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: That Silvia is excelling;

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: She excels each mortal thing

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: Upon the dull earth dwelling:

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: To her let us garlands bring.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: How now! are you sadder than you were before? How

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: do you, man? the music likes you not.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: You mistake; the musician likes me not.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: Why, my pretty youth?

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: He plays false, father.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: How? out of tune on the strings?

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: Not so; but yet so false that he grieves my very

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: heart-strings.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: You have a quick ear.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: Ay, I would I were deaf; it makes me have a slow heart.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: I perceive you delight not in music.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: Not a whit, when it jars so.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: Hark, what fine change is in the music!

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: Ay, that change is the spite.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: You would have them always play but one thing?

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: I would always have one play but one thing.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: But, host, doth this Sir Proteus that we talk on

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: Often resort unto this gentlewoman?

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: I tell you what Launce, his man, told me: he loved

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: her out of all nick.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: Where is Launce?

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: Gone to seek his dog; which tomorrow, by his

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: master's command, he must carry for a present to his lady.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: Peace! stand aside: the company parts.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Sir Thurio, fear not you: I will so plead

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: That you shall say my cunning drift excels.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: THURIO
line: Where meet we?

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: At Saint Gregory's well.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: THURIO
line: Farewell.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Madam, good even to your ladyship.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: I thank you for your music, gentlemen.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Who is that that spake?

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: One, lady, if you knew his pure heart's truth,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: You would quickly learn to know him by his voice.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Sir Proteus, as I take it.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Sir Proteus, gentle lady, and your servant.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: What's your will?

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: That I may compass yours.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: You have your wish; my will is even this:

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: That presently you hie you home to bed.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
