speaker: SILVIA
line: Thou subtle, perjured, false, disloyal man!

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Think'st thou I am so shallow, so conceitless,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: To be seduced by thy flattery,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: That hast deceived so many with thy vows?

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Return, return, and make thy love amends.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: For me, by this pale queen of night I swear,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: I am so far from granting thy request

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: That I despise thee for thy wrongful suit,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: And by and by intend to chide myself

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Even for this time I spend in talking to thee.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I grant, sweet love, that I did love a lady;

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But she is dead.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: Aside        'Twere false, if I should speak it;

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: For I am sure she is not buried.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Say that she be; yet Valentine thy friend

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Survives; to whom, thyself art witness,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: I am betroth'd: and art thou not ashamed

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: To wrong him with thy importunacy?

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I likewise hear that Valentine is dead.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: And so suppose am I; for in his grave

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Assure thyself my love is buried.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Sweet lady, let me rake it from the earth.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Go to thy lady's grave and call hers thence,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Or, at the least, in hers sepulchre thine.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: Aside  He heard not that.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Madam, if your heart be so obdurate,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Vouchsafe me yet your picture for my love,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: The picture that is hanging in your chamber;

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: To that I'll speak, to that I'll sigh and weep:

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: For since the substance of your perfect self

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Is else devoted, I am but a shadow;

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And to your shadow will I make true love.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: Aside  If 'twere a substance, you would, sure,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: deceive it,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: And make it but a shadow, as I am.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: I am very loath to be your idol, sir;

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: But since your falsehood shall become you well

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: To worship shadows and adore false shapes,

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Send to me in the morning and I'll send it:

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: SILVIA
line: And so, good rest.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: As wretches have o'ernight

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: That wait for execution in the morn.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: Host, will you go?

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: By my halidom, I was fast asleep.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: Pray you, where lies Sir Proteus?

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: Marry, at my house. Trust me, I think 'tis almost

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: Host
line: day.

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: Not so; but it hath been the longest night

scene: SCENE II.  Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.
speaker: JULIA
line: That e'er I watch'd and the most heaviest.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Or ne'er return again into my sight.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Away, I say! stay'st thou to vex me here?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: A slave, that still an end turns me to shame!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Sebastian, I have entertained thee,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Partly that I have need of such a youth

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: That can with some discretion do my business,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: For 'tis no trusting to yond foolish lout,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But chiefly for thy face and thy behavior,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Which, if my augury deceive me not,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Witness good bringing up, fortune and truth:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Therefore know thou, for this I entertain thee.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Go presently and take this ring with thee,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Deliver it to Madam Silvia:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: She loved me well deliver'd it to me.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: It seems you loved not her, to leave her token.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: She is dead, belike?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Not so; I think she lives.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Alas!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Why dost thou cry 'alas'?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: I cannot choose

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: But pity her.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Wherefore shouldst thou pity her?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Because methinks that she loved you as well

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: As you do love your lady Silvia:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: She dreams of him that has forgot her love;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: You dote on her that cares not for your love.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: 'Tis pity love should be so contrary;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: And thinking of it makes me cry 'alas!'

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Well, give her that ring and therewithal

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: This letter. That's her chamber. Tell my lady

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I claim the promise for her heavenly picture.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Your message done, hie home unto my chamber,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Where thou shalt find me, sad and solitary.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: How many women would do such a message?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Alas, poor Proteus! thou hast entertain'd

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: A fox to be the shepherd of thy lambs.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Alas, poor fool! why do I pity him

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: That with his very heart despiseth me?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Because he loves her, he despiseth me;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Because I love him I must pity him.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: This ring I gave him when he parted from me,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: To bind him to remember my good will;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: And now am I, unhappy messenger,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: To plead for that which I would not obtain,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: To carry that which I would have refused,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: To praise his faith which I would have dispraised.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: I am my master's true-confirmed love;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: But cannot be true servant to my master,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Unless I prove false traitor to myself.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Yet will I woo for him, but yet so coldly

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: As, heaven it knows, I would not have him speed.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Gentlewoman, good day! I pray you, be my mean

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: To bring me where to speak with Madam Silvia.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: What would you with her, if that I be she?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: If you be she, I do entreat your patience

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: To hear me speak the message I am sent on.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: From whom?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: From my master, Sir Proteus, madam.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: O, he sends you for a picture.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Ay, madam.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Ursula, bring my picture here.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Go give your master this: tell him from me,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: One Julia, that his changing thoughts forget,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Would better fit his chamber than this shadow.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Madam, please you peruse this letter.--

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Pardon me, madam; I have unadvised

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Deliver'd you a paper that I should not:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: This is the letter to your ladyship.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: I pray thee, let me look on that again.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: It may not be; good madam, pardon me.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: There, hold!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: I will not look upon your master's lines:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: I know they are stuff'd with protestations

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: And full of new-found oaths; which he will break

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: As easily as I do tear his paper.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Madam, he sends your ladyship this ring.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: The more shame for him that he sends it me;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: For I have heard him say a thousand times

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: His Julia gave it him at his departure.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Though his false finger have profaned the ring,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Mine shall not do his Julia so much wrong.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: She thanks you.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: What say'st thou?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: I thank you, madam, that you tender her.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Poor gentlewoman! my master wrongs her much.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Dost thou know her?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Almost as well as I do know myself:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: To think upon her woes I do protest

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: That I have wept a hundred several times.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Belike she thinks that Proteus hath forsook her.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: I think she doth; and that's her cause of sorrow.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Is she not passing fair?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: She hath been fairer, madam, than she is:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: When she did think my master loved her well,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: She, in my judgment, was as fair as you:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: But since she did neglect her looking-glass

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: And threw her sun-expelling mask away,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: The air hath starved the roses in her cheeks

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: And pinch'd the lily-tincture of her face,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: That now she is become as black as I.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: How tall was she?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: About my stature; for at Pentecost,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: When all our pageants of delight were play'd,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Our youth got me to play the woman's part,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: And I was trimm'd in Madam Julia's gown,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Which served me as fit, by all men's judgments,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: As if the garment had been made for me:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Therefore I know she is about my height.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: And at that time I made her weep agood,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: For I did play a lamentable part:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Madam, 'twas Ariadne passioning

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: For Theseus' perjury and unjust flight;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Which I so lively acted with my tears

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: That my poor mistress, moved therewithal,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Wept bitterly; and would I might be dead

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: If I in thought felt not her very sorrow!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: She is beholding to thee, gentle youth.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Alas, poor lady, desolate and left!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: I weep myself to think upon thy words.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Here, youth, there is my purse; I give thee this

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: For thy sweet mistress' sake, because thou lovest her.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Farewell.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: And she shall thank you for't, if e'er you know her.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: A virtuous gentlewoman, mild and beautiful

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: I hope my master's suit will be but cold,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Since she respects my mistress' love so much.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Alas, how love can trifle with itself!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Here is her picture: let me see; I think,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: If I had such a tire, this face of mine

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Were full as lovely as is this of hers:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: And yet the painter flatter'd her a little,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Unless I flatter with myself too much.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Her hair is auburn, mine is perfect yellow:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: If that be all the difference in his love,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: I'll get me such a colour'd periwig.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Her eyes are grey as glass, and so are mine:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Ay, but her forehead's low, and mine's as high.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: What should it be that he respects in her

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: But I can make respective in myself,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: If this fond Love were not a blinded god?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Come, shadow, come and take this shadow up,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: For 'tis thy rival. O thou senseless form,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: Thou shalt be worshipp'd, kiss'd, loved and adored!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: And, were there sense in his idolatry,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: My substance should be statue in thy stead.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: I'll use thee kindly for thy mistress' sake,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: That used me so; or else, by Jove I vow,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: I should have scratch'd out your unseeing eyes

scene: SCENE IV.  The same.
speaker: JULIA
line: To make my master out of love with thee!

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. An abbey.
speaker: EGLAMOUR
line: The sun begins to gild the western sky;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. An abbey.
speaker: EGLAMOUR
line: And now it is about the very hour

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. An abbey.
speaker: EGLAMOUR
line: That Silvia, at Friar Patrick's cell, should meet me.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. An abbey.
speaker: EGLAMOUR
line: She will not fail, for lovers break not hours,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. An abbey.
speaker: EGLAMOUR
line: Unless it be to come before their time;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. An abbey.
speaker: EGLAMOUR
line: So much they spur their expedition.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. An abbey.
speaker: EGLAMOUR
line: See where she comes.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. An abbey.
speaker: EGLAMOUR
line: Lady, a happy evening!

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. An abbey.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Amen, amen! Go on, good Eglamour,

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. An abbey.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Out at the postern by the abbey-wall:

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. An abbey.
speaker: SILVIA
line: I fear I am attended by some spies.

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. An abbey.
speaker: EGLAMOUR
line: Fear not: the forest is not three leagues off;

scene: SCENE I.  Milan. An abbey.
speaker: EGLAMOUR
line: If we recover that, we are sure enough.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: Sir Proteus, what says Silvia to my suit?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: O, sir, I find her milder than she was;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And yet she takes exceptions at your person.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: What, that my leg is too long?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: No; that it is too little.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: I'll wear a boot, to make it somewhat rounder.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: JULIA
line: Aside  But love will not be spurr'd to what

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: JULIA
line: it loathes.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: What says she to my face?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: She says it is a fair one.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: Nay then, the wanton lies; my face is black.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But pearls are fair; and the old saying is,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Black men are pearls in beauteous ladies' eyes.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: JULIA
line: Aside  'Tis true; such pearls as put out

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: JULIA
line: ladies' eyes;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: JULIA
line: For I had rather wink than look on them.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: How likes she my discourse?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Ill, when you talk of war.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: But well, when I discourse of love and peace?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: JULIA
line: Aside  But better, indeed, when you hold your peace.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: What says she to my valour?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: O, sir, she makes no doubt of that.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: JULIA
line: Aside  She needs not, when she knows it cowardice.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: What says she to my birth?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: That you are well derived.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: JULIA
line: Aside  True; from a gentleman to a fool.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: Considers she my possessions?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: O, ay; and pities them.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: Wherefore?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: JULIA
line: Aside  That such an ass should owe them.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: That they are out by lease.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: JULIA
line: Here comes the duke.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: How now, Sir Proteus! how now, Thurio!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Which of you saw Sir Eglamour of late?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: Not I.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Nor I.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Saw you my daughter?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Neither.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Why then,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: She's fled unto that peasant Valentine;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: And Eglamour is in her company.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: 'Tis true; for Friar Laurence met them both,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: As he in penance wander'd through the forest;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Him he knew well, and guess'd that it was she,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: But, being mask'd, he was not sure of it;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Besides, she did intend confession

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: At Patrick's cell this even; and there she was not;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: These likelihoods confirm her flight from hence.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Therefore, I pray you, stand not to discourse,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: But mount you presently and meet with me

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Upon the rising of the mountain-foot

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: That leads towards Mantua, whither they are fled:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: DUKE
line: Dispatch, sweet gentlemen, and follow me.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: Why, this it is to be a peevish girl,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: That flies her fortune when it follows her.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: I'll after, more to be revenged on Eglamour

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: THURIO
line: Than for the love of reckless Silvia.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And I will follow, more for Silvia's love

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Than hate of Eglamour that goes with her.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: JULIA
line: And I will follow, more to cross that love

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The DUKE's palace.
speaker: JULIA
line: Than hate for Silvia that is gone for love.

scene: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.
speaker: First Outlaw
line: Come, come,

scene: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.
speaker: First Outlaw
line: Be patient; we must bring you to our captain.

scene: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: A thousand more mischances than this one

scene: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Have learn'd me how to brook this patiently.

scene: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.
speaker: Second Outlaw
line: Come, bring her away.

scene: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.
speaker: First Outlaw
line: Where is the gentleman that was with her?

scene: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: Being nimble-footed, he hath outrun us,

scene: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: But Moyses and Valerius follow him.

scene: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: Go thou with her to the west end of the wood;

scene: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: There is our captain: we'll follow him that's fled;

scene: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.
speaker: Third Outlaw
line: The thicket is beset; he cannot 'scape.

scene: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.
speaker: First Outlaw
line: Come, I must bring you to our captain's cave:

scene: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.
speaker: First Outlaw
line: Fear not; he bears an honourable mind,

scene: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.
speaker: First Outlaw
line: And will not use a woman lawlessly.

scene: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: O Valentine, this I endure for thee!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: How use doth breed a habit in a man!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: This shadowy desert, unfrequented woods,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: I better brook than flourishing peopled towns:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Here can I sit alone, unseen of any,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And to the nightingale's complaining notes

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Tune my distresses and record my woes.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: O thou that dost inhabit in my breast,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Leave not the mansion so long tenantless,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Lest, growing ruinous, the building fall

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And leave no memory of what it was!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Repair me with thy presence, Silvia;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Thou gentle nymph, cherish thy forlorn swain!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: What halloing and what stir is this to-day?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: These are my mates, that make their wills their law,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Have some unhappy passenger in chase.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: They love me well; yet I have much to do

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: To keep them from uncivil outrages.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Withdraw thee, Valentine: who's this comes here?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Madam, this service I have done for you,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Though you respect not aught your servant doth,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: To hazard life and rescue you from him

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: That would have forced your honour and your love;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Vouchsafe me, for my meed, but one fair look;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: A smaller boon than this I cannot beg

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And less than this, I am sure, you cannot give.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Aside  How like a dream is this I see and hear!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Love, lend me patience to forbear awhile.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: O miserable, unhappy that I am!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Unhappy were you, madam, ere I came;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But by my coming I have made you happy.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: By thy approach thou makest me most unhappy.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: JULIA
line: Aside  And me, when he approacheth to your presence.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Had I been seized by a hungry lion,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: I would have been a breakfast to the beast,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Rather than have false Proteus rescue me.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: O, Heaven be judge how I love Valentine,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Whose life's as tender to me as my soul!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: And full as much, for more there cannot be,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: I do detest false perjured Proteus.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Therefore be gone; solicit me no more.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: What dangerous action, stood it next to death,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Would I not undergo for one calm look!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: O, 'tis the curse in love, and still approved,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: When women cannot love where they're beloved!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: When Proteus cannot love where he's beloved.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Read over Julia's heart, thy first best love,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: For whose dear sake thou didst then rend thy faith

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Into a thousand oaths; and all those oaths

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Descended into perjury, to love me.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Thou hast no faith left now, unless thou'dst two;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: And that's far worse than none; better have none

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Than plural faith which is too much by one:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: Thou counterfeit to thy true friend!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: In love

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Who respects friend?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: All men but Proteus.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Nay, if the gentle spirit of moving words

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Can no way change you to a milder form,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I'll woo you like a soldier, at arms' end,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: And love you 'gainst the nature of love,--force ye.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: SILVIA
line: O heaven!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I'll force thee yield to my desire.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Ruffian, let go that rude uncivil touch,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Thou friend of an ill fashion!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Valentine!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Thou common friend, that's without faith or love,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: For such is a friend now; treacherous man!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Thou hast beguiled my hopes; nought but mine eye

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Could have persuaded me: now I dare not say

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: I have one friend alive; thou wouldst disprove me.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Who should be trusted, when one's own right hand

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Is perjured to the bosom? Proteus,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: I am sorry I must never trust thee more,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: But count the world a stranger for thy sake.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: The private wound is deepest: O time most accurst,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: 'Mongst all foes that a friend should be the worst!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: My shame and guilt confounds me.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Forgive me, Valentine: if hearty sorrow

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Be a sufficient ransom for offence,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I tender 't here; I do as truly suffer

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: As e'er I did commit.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Then I am paid;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And once again I do receive thee honest.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Who by repentance is not satisfied

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Is nor of heaven nor earth, for these are pleased.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: By penitence the Eternal's wrath's appeased:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And, that my love may appear plain and free,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: All that was mine in Silvia I give thee.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: JULIA
line: O me unhappy!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Look to the boy.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Why, boy! why, wag! how now! what's the matter?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Look up; speak.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: JULIA
line: O good sir, my master charged me to deliver a ring

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: JULIA
line: to Madam Silvia, which, out of my neglect, was never done.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Where is that ring, boy?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: JULIA
line: Here 'tis; this is it.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: How! let me see:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Why, this is the ring I gave to Julia.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: JULIA
line: O, cry you mercy, sir, I have mistook:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: JULIA
line: This is the ring you sent to Silvia.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But how camest thou by this ring? At my depart

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: I gave this unto Julia.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: JULIA
line: And Julia herself did give it me;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: JULIA
line: And Julia herself hath brought it hither.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: How! Julia!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: JULIA
line: Behold her that gave aim to all thy oaths,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: JULIA
line: And entertain'd 'em deeply in her heart.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: JULIA
line: How oft hast thou with perjury cleft the root!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: JULIA
line: O Proteus, let this habit make thee blush!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: JULIA
line: Be thou ashamed that I have took upon me

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: JULIA
line: Such an immodest raiment, if shame live

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: JULIA
line: In a disguise of love:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: JULIA
line: It is the lesser blot, modesty finds,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: JULIA
line: Women to change their shapes than men their minds.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Than men their minds! 'tis true.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: O heaven! were man

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: But constant, he were perfect. That one error

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Fills him with faults; makes him run through all the sins:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Inconstancy falls off ere it begins.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: What is in Silvia's face, but I may spy

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: More fresh in Julia's with a constant eye?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Come, come, a hand from either:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Let me be blest to make this happy close;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: 'Twere pity two such friends should be long foes.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: PROTEUS
line: Bear witness, Heaven, I have my wish for ever.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: JULIA
line: And I mine.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: Outlaws
line: A prize, a prize, a prize!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Forbear, forbear, I say! it is my lord the duke.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Your grace is welcome to a man disgraced,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Banished Valentine.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: DUKE
line: Sir Valentine!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: THURIO
line: Yonder is Silvia; and Silvia's mine.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Thurio, give back, or else embrace thy death;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Come not within the measure of my wrath;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Do not name Silvia thine; if once again,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Verona shall not hold thee. Here she stands;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Take but possession of her with a touch:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: I dare thee but to breathe upon my love.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: THURIO
line: Sir Valentine, I care not for her, I;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: THURIO
line: I hold him but a fool that will endanger

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: THURIO
line: His body for a girl that loves him not:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: THURIO
line: I claim her not, and therefore she is thine.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: DUKE
line: The more degenerate and base art thou,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: DUKE
line: To make such means for her as thou hast done

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: DUKE
line: And leave her on such slight conditions.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: DUKE
line: Now, by the honour of my ancestry,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: DUKE
line: I do applaud thy spirit, Valentine,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: DUKE
line: And think thee worthy of an empress' love:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: DUKE
line: Know then, I here forget all former griefs,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: DUKE
line: Cancel all grudge, repeal thee home again,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: DUKE
line: Plead a new state in thy unrivall'd merit,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: DUKE
line: To which I thus subscribe: Sir Valentine,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: DUKE
line: Thou art a gentleman and well derived;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: DUKE
line: Take thou thy Silvia, for thou hast deserved her.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: I thank your grace; the gift hath made me happy.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: I now beseech you, for your daughter's sake,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: To grant one boom that I shall ask of you.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: DUKE
line: I grant it, for thine own, whate'er it be.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: These banish'd men that I have kept withal

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Are men endued with worthy qualities:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Forgive them what they have committed here

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And let them be recall'd from their exile:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: They are reformed, civil, full of good

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And fit for great employment, worthy lord.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: DUKE
line: Thou hast prevail'd; I pardon them and thee:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: DUKE
line: Dispose of them as thou know'st their deserts.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: DUKE
line: Come, let us go: we will include all jars

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: DUKE
line: With triumphs, mirth and rare solemnity.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: And, as we walk along, I dare be bold

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: With our discourse to make your grace to smile.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: What think you of this page, my lord?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: DUKE
line: I think the boy hath grace in him; he blushes.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: I warrant you, my lord, more grace than boy.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: DUKE
line: What mean you by that saying?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Please you, I'll tell you as we pass along,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: That you will wonder what hath fortuned.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: Come, Proteus; 'tis your penance but to hear

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: The story of your loves discovered:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: That done, our day of marriage shall be yours;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: VALENTINE
line: One feast, one house, one mutual happiness.
